verse.roman:
taṁ gandhaṁ madhu-dhārāyā
vāyunopahṛtaṁ balaḥ
āghrāyopagatas tatra
lalanābhiḥ samaṁ papau

synonyms: tam—that; gandham—fragrance; madhu—of honey; dhārāyāḥ—of the flood; vāyunā—by the breeze; upahṛtam—brought near; balaḥ—Lord Balarāma; āghrāya—smelling; upagataḥ—having approached; tatra—there; lalanābhiḥ—with the young women; samam—together; papau—drank.
translation: The wind carried to Balarāma the fragrance of that flood of sweet liquor, and when He smelled it He went [to the tree]. There He and His female companions drank.
